minimal_society.description: Create a verified multi-agent society in 3 lines
minimal_society.code:
from lib.society.simple import create_agent_society

society = create_agent_society("MyProject", agents=["orchestrator", "worker"])
result = society.send("orchestrator", "worker", {"task": "analyze"})

best_practices: Document the pattern usage and rationale in code
Always verify agent capabilities before sending messages using get_agent_status() to check trust level
Use appropriate trust tier (L0-L4) based on risk - start with L0_local for development, escalate only when needed
Create explicit contracts for agent interactions that require guarantees - don't rely on implicit trust
Monitor reputation scores and respond to violations promptly to maintain society health
Use message types correctly - REQUEST for actions, INFORM for updates, PROPOSE for negotiations
Export audit logs regularly for compliance and debugging - event sourcing enables full replay
Start with simple presets (supervisor_worker, peer_society) before building custom topologies
Always include axiom_context in critical actions to enable verification and compliance checking
Use broadcast() sparingly - prefer targeted send() for better performance and clearer intent
Document contract obligations and prohibitions clearly - agents cannot infer implicit rules
